suyūr.commentsEnglish: tests

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts with ḥijāz dūgāh, followed by rāst nawā. Descending it uses buselīk nawā, followed by ḥijāz dūgāh and ends on 'irāq
Starts on 'iraq or dūgāh descending until yegāh, then bayāt dūgāh until nawā then rāst nawā and descends to the qarār which is 'irāq

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Sayr can start from chahārgāh or nawā, ascends and then descends until the qarār. Ascent is not defined, so it is assumed that it will be in jins rāst al-nawā following the construction of the maqām.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Begins on nawā, then ḥuseinī and 'ajam until muḥayyar ascending and descending, then descends from nawā until yegāh with a touch of qarār ḥijāz before ending on its qarār, yegāh. Therefore it is assumed that the initial ascents and descents are in jins nahāwand nawā as per the construction of the maqām. Also the note qarār ḥijāz does not exist in the list of note names provided by Shawwā in his book.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.

suyūr.commentsEnglish: nahāwand nawā, followed by ḥijāz dūgāh then the qarār, yegāh, with a touch of qarār ḥijāz

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Start with jins bayāt on dūgāh, ending on 'irāq. Then ascend and descend ending on note 'ushayrān. Repeat jins bayāt on dūgāh, and descend to end on the qarār which is yegāh. This maqām name corresponds with a Persian Gushe also called Majlis Afrooz in the Dastgah Mahūr and Dastgāh Shūr. In Mahūr it bears no melodic or intervallic resemblance, but in Shūr the jins bayāt is prominent.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Start on nawā to huseinī and what's above it (jins kurd huseinī), then jins bayāt on dūgāh. After it's descent ascend bayat dūgāh and during the descent use the note kurdī instead of segāh (i.e. jins kurd on dūgāh) and descend to end on yegāh using a touch of qarār ḥijāz. This maqām is Ottoman and not really utilised in Arabic music but Shawwā listed it either way.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Begins on nawā to develop bayāt on dūgāh, then bayāt 'ushayran and upon reaching muḥayyar in the ascent, it descends until dūgāh using 'ajam instead of awj (jins kurd ḥuseinī) and its qarār is 'ushayrān.
etetwet
Starts on nawā to render maqām bayāt al-dūgāh and descends to ʿushayrān to render maqām bayāt al-ḥuseinī and descends stepwise until it's qarār ʿushayrān.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts with bayāt on ḥuseinī followed by nikrīz on rast and returns to bayāt al-ḥuseinī so it's tonal centre is ḥuseinī but they have today made it's qarār ʿushayrān
Starts on ḥiṣār to render ḥijāz  on ḥuseinī followed by maqām nawā athar al-dugāh then ḥijāz on ʿushayrān and it ends on its qarār ʿushayrān

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts on chahargāh to render maqām ṣabā on dugāh with a highlighting of maqām ḥijāz on chahargāh, then ascending to render bayāt on muḥayyar followed by a descent in nahāwand on nawā followed by kurdī on dugāh and it ends on its qarār with a rendering of maqām kurdī on ʿushayrān. In modern Turkish it is known as makam Şevkutarab.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: There is a discrepancy in Shawwā's representation of this maqām. In the "rules" section it says: Starts on ḥijaz to render rast al-dugāh then ascends to muḥayyar and during the descent 'ajam is used to render bayāt dugāh then kurd on dugāh then ḥijaz on dugāh and it ends on 'ushayrān. But in the "analysis" section it says: First, jins bayāt 'ushayrān, second, jins rāst dugāh, third, bayāt ḥuseinī. Then ascend to render bayāt muḥayyar and descend to render rast nawā, followed by kurdī or ḥijāz dugāh, then nikrīz rāst and ends with bayāt 'ushayran. Rāst dūgāh does not render in most tuning systems, and the note ḥijāz doesn't comply with it's jins. Needs to be researched

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts on chahargāh ascending to kurdān and above to render ḥijāz chahargāh, then descends from chahargāh until it's qarār 'ajam 'ushayrān

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts on kurdān ascending to jawāb nawā (saham/ramal tuti) then descends from nawā to its qarār using chahargāh and kurdī. In the "analysis" it states that one must descend at the end to qarār ḥijāz before ending on 'ajam 'ushayrān.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts on chahargāh until nawā to render bayāt dūgāh, followed by rāst nawā, followed by bayāt muḥayyar, then descends to render rāst nawā, followed by nahāwand nawā, followed by bayāt dūgāh and from dūgāh descends until the qarār which is 'irāq.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: "Rules": Starts with rāst on dūgāh then descends to 'irāq and from there descends to yegāh and then ends on the qarār, 'irāq. Note: maqām bayāt muḥayyar should be rendered during the ascent. An alternative sayr is to start on awj to render rāst kurdān, then 'irāq on awj, then descending until its qarār, 'irāq."Analysis": jins segah on 'irāq, jins rāst on dūgāh, jins bayat on muhayyar, then descends until 'irāq. Slightly conflicting directions. Must be clarified.
Starts on ṣabā dūgāh and it's qarār is irāq

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Rules: Starts on 'ajam and ascends to awj then descends to segāh, the ascends to to shahnāz and muḥayyar, and upon descent it ends on 'irāq. Analysis: nagham awj ara on 'irāq, jins musta'ār on segāh, jins awj on awj, descends according to its pitch classes until the qarār ('irāq)

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Rules: Starts on kurdī to segāh and continues ascending to nawā, then from nawā ascends to buzurk, then descends to segāh and from segāh to it's qarār 'iraq. Analysis: jins awj arā on 'irāq, jins nagham musta'ār on segāh, jins buselīk on nawā then ascends until buzurk and descends stepwise until it's qarār
